description: From Middle English exalten, from Old French exalter, from Latin exalt≈ç.

verbs.description: exalt (third-person singular simple present exalts, present participle exalting, simple past and past participle exalted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To honor; to hold in high esteem.
(transitive) To raise in rank, status etc., to elevate.
examples: The man was exalted from a humble carpenter to a minister.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To elate, or fill with the joy of success.
(transitive, chemistry, archaic) To refine or subtilize.
